name: Canterbury Bells
climate: Prefers a temperate climate with cool summers and mild winters.
Thrives in regions where the temperature is not too extreme.
Canterbury Bells grow best in areas with a marked seasonal change.
They do not tolerate very hot or excessively cold climates.
sunlight: They require full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
Direct sunlight for at least six hours per day is ideal.
Too much shade will lead to reduced flowering and lanky growth.
In hot climates, some afternoon shade may be beneficial.
watering: Regular watering is required to keep the soil consistently moist.
Overwatering should be avoided to prevent root rot and other issues.
During dry spells, more frequent watering may be necessary.
It's crucial to maintain a balance; neither too dry nor too wet.
soil: They need well-drained soil rich in organic matter for nutrition.
Soil should be fertile with a slightly acidic to neutral pH level.
Heavy clay soils should be amended to improve drainage and aeration.
A balanced soil mixture ensures proper root growth and flower production.
toxic: Canterbury Bells are mildly toxic if ingested by pets or humans.
extra_care_tip: Deadheading can promote continuous blooming throughout the season.
Support stems if plants become tall or leggy to prevent toppling.
